text:
- Sigue is a money
transfer service operating
in about 160 countries worldwide,

with operational centers
in Los Angeles, Mexico,
Beijing, and India.
- The challenge which we face

before we started using the
AWS on our primary data centers
is we always have to constantly kind of
maintain the systems,

and it's not kind of stable
enough, or robust enough,

or scalable enough to
meet our customer needs.
The IT downtime is very, very critical,
because every minute counts.
If our system is not up and available,
then we'll be losing sales revenue.
That's very critical for the company.

We need to have the system
up and running 24 hours
all the time, 365 days.

- And so by migrating
into AWS into the cloud,
we're able to provide an environment where

our system internally
would perform at its best.
- From a benefit standpoint,

it's again goes back to
the fundamental thing.

IT downtime, we had kind
of literally reduced to,
instead of hours, to minutes.

- AWS application migration
service really accelerated us,
'cause it was a great tool for us to use.
And it allowed us to get great speed
in moving our legacy system to the cloud.
And furthermore reducing our costs.

So the AWS platform really
helped us in a few points.
One was scalability.

So allow us to expand across
the globe in a speedy manner.
The second is really cost reductions
around the organization.

Not maintaining servers
or data centers for us.
And three, really providing stability
to our customers, right?

Having an uptime percentage
increase almost 5%
allows our customer to trust us more,

and allow us to build those
relationships with them
as we continue into the future.

- Customers who are able to
send the money through Sigue,

the receivers will get
the money in no time.

That's the assurance we
always give our customers,
or our end users.
(upbeat music)
